extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 (14.5 oz.) can diced tomatoes, not drained

extendedIngredients.name: oregano
extendedIngredients.original: 1 teaspoon dried oregano or 1 Tbsp. fresh, chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: dried oregano or 1 Tbsp. fresh, chopped

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds medium shrimp, peeled, deveined and rinsed

title: Shrimp with Tomatoes and Feta
summary: Shrimp with Tomatoes and Feta might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs $4.4 per serving. Watching your figure? This gluten free, primal, and pescatarian recipe has 341 calories, 40g of protein, and 16g of fat per serving. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up canned tomatoes, pepper, olive oil, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 20 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 63%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Baked Shrimp with Tomatoes and Feta, Baked Shrimp With Tomatoes And Feta, and Shrimp with Tomatoes and Feta Cheese.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 99 dollars.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Warm oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes, crushed red pepper and olives, and simmer until mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes.                                                                                                Add shrimp and cook, stirring, until shrimp are pink and firm, 4 to 5 minutes.                                                                                                Divide shrimp and tomatoes among 4 plates. Sprinkle each with feta cheese and oregano and serve hot.

steps.step: Warm oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes, crushed red pepper and olives, and simmer until mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook, stirring, until shrimp are pink and firm, 4 to 5 minutes.
Divide shrimp and tomatoes among 4 plates.
Sprinkle each with feta cheese and oregano and serve hot.
